arts.ttl: Matt Hamshaw in frank Derby County verdict after 'frustrating' Oxford United stalemate
arts.sum: Matt Hamshaw said he was "disappointed and frustrated" by Derby County's performance after they were held to a goalless draw by Oxford United. We're trying to build and play through, but it (the pitch) is probably just not allowing us to move the ball quick enough to to get Oxford out of tilt really."

arts.ttl: Derby County player ratings v Oxford United as duo struggle as Rams close on Eustace - Leigh Curtis
arts.sum: After the break, Derby tried to up the tempo in order to create chances and their best chance of the game fell to Lars-Jorgen Salvesen who met a Callum Elder corner but saw Jamie Cumming make a save. Derby tried to summon a response and Nat Phillips did lift an effort over the bar from a set-piece before Nathaniel Mendez-Laing drove a shot straight at Jamie Cumming.

arts.ttl: Derby’s winless run goes on with Oxford stalemate
arts.sum: The Rams are expected to appoint John Eustace imminently.

arts.ttl: Derby County manager update as John Eustace talks continue
arts.sum: John Eustace is in ongoing talks with Derby County with the club still expected to appoint him as manager after decision to leave Blackburn Rovers. It is possible that the club will instead chose to announce his appointment either straight after the game or in the morning.

arts.ttl: Double change for Derby County v Oxford United as Rams close to John Eustace announcement
arts.sum: Derby: Zetterstrom, Langas, Phillips, Clarke; Jackson, Adams, Ozoh, Elder; Goudmijn, Mendez-Laing; Salvesen The double change that has been made is that Kayden Jackson has replaced Liam Thompson while Callum Elder comes back into the team at the expense of Ben Osborn.

arts.ttl: UPDATES: Derby County v Oxford United – live
arts.sum: All the build-up, action and reaction as Oxford United make the trip to third from bottom Derby County. The U’s saw their nine-game unbeaten start in Sky Bet Championship under Gary Rowett come to an end with a 1-0 defeat at Burnley. Derby County (22nd) v Oxford United (17th) Comment below or tweet @OxfordMailOUFC to get involved.

arts.ttl: John Eustace contract refusal claim made as board meeting ends with final Derby County decision
arts.sum: The relegation-threatened Rams are looking for a new manager after sacking Paul Warne on Friday, and it seems old boy Eustace was clearly their top choice from day one - or even sooner, according to the Telegraph. According to an "exclusive" report in the Lancashire Telegraph, Eustace met the Blackburn board and asked for a new contract and assurances over investment in his squad.

arts.ttl: Derby County, Hull City eyeing out-of-contract League Two star
arts.sum: Derby County and Hull City are among the sides eyeing Doncaster Rovers defender Joseph Olowu, according to Football… The post Derby County, Hull City eyeing out-of-contract League Two star appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Derby County handed clear John Eustace next manager verdict after Blackburn statement
arts.sum: Derby County are in advanced talks to poach Blackburn Rovers manager John Eustace, after sacking Paul Warne last week amid a miserable run of results - and while fans in the Derbyshire Live comments section will be glad to see a new man to try to lead them clear of relegation trouble, they have been having their say on swapping potential promotion for a relegation battle. Eustace is reportedly disappointed by Blackburn's January transfer business, which the club addressed in an official statement, mentioning "significant investment being made during the January transfer window."

arts.ttl: Blackburn supporter group issues 'damning' statement with John Eustace set for Derby County
arts.sum: To lose him from a play-off position to a team currently in the relegation zone is a damning indictment of everything that is wrong with our club. Derby are currently in the relegation zone and Saturday’s 1-1 draw at Norwich City arrested a seven-game losing run.
